alert.note: Alert for Adair; Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 27 at 12:47AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CST FOR BENTON...WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN...CRAWFORD...NORTHERN SEBASTIAN... WASHINGTON...EASTERN SEQUOYAH...CENTRAL ADAIR AND NORTHEASTERN LE FLORE COUNTIES... At 1246 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Goodman to 2 miles north of Bentonville to 2 miles southwest of Tontitown to 4 miles southwest of Cedarville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Van Buren... Siloam Springs... Stilwell... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Bella Vista... Lowell... Farmington... Alma... Pea Ridge... Barling... Prairie Grove... Muldrow... Roland... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 315 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 93. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
